div.sent: There is a difference between an ordinary call and call by Jesus.
Generally sermon is a kind of call.
But when we call anyone for any little purposes we don't consider it a sermon.
A sermon is always used for special purpose.
We have already learnt that Samuel had a call from God for a special work.
Thus Jesus Christ gave a call to his Apostles.
There had been a lot of good work starting up on this earth by Jesus.
They were about preaching love, mercy, peace and forgiveness.
That is why he founded a Church.
He knew he would not live on earth as a human being forever.
But his work must continue.
The Church should not be perished.
It should continue forever.
Lord Jesus had twelve Apostles.
One of them was Peter.
Like others Jesus gave a call to Peter for a definite mission.
Peter also responded to his call.
We will now learn this from the Holy Bible.
He saw two fishermen Simon and Andrew catching fish over there.
They were brothers.
Jesus said to them, Come with me.
I will teach you what I do.
I will teach you how to catch human beings.
Jesus changed Simon's name as Peter, which means 'a stone' or a rock.
Jesus gave this name because his faith in God was as firm as a stone.
We have learnt that Jesus gave a call to Simon and his brother, Andrew.
And the two brothers, at once left everything and followed Jesus.
This is what we call a response to a call.
When Jesus calls somebody, he or she should respond in this way.
For three years Peter followed Jesus like a shadow.
He learnt many things from Jesus.
He saw Jesus was not an ordinary man.
One day Jesus asked a question to his Apostles.
It was a difficult one to answer directly.
He asked them, Now tell me, what do you know about me?
All disciples were silent.
Only Peter answered, You are the son of the living God.
You are the Saviour.
Jesus had great trust on Peter.
So he said to him: You are Peter, which means, a stone.
Upon this stone I shall build my Church.
Thus I shall give you the keys of the Heaven.
Through the discussions above Peter assumed many important responsibilities from Jesus.
Jesus made Peter the director of his Church.
Peter's faith was firm.
Jesus described Peter's faith as firm and strong as the stone.
To guide the Church of Jesus Christ one must have deep faith.
Jesus gave the key of Heaven to Peter.
He believed that human beings can go to Heaven through his guidance.
That is, peter will turn man back from the path of sin.
After Resurrection Jesus appeared before Peter and said, Keep an eye on my sheep.
Thus Jesus gave Peter the responsibilities to look after the Christian devotees.
This is why, Peter is the first Pope of the Church.
We already know Peter was the Pope of the Church.
Jesus gave this responsibility to Peter.
So Peter would never forget the responsibilities on him.
It was his prime duty to preach the messages of Jesus.
One day Peter saw many people outside the Church.
They were all Jews.
These Jews killed Jesus.
But Peter was not afraid of them.
He preached the massages of love, peace and forgiveness of Jesus with courage.
For Jesus was the saviour of mankind.
As a result, their mind changed and they begged forgiveness for their sin.
Peter baptised them.
On that day three thousand people were baptised.
One day Peter was going to the Church.
As he came to the door he saw a lame man.
He was begging.
His relatives took him there and made him sit at the door.
As he saw Peter, he begged for alms to him.
Peter said, I have no money, nor have I any gold.
I have the name of Jesus with me.
I say, you walk along with the name of the crucified Jesus.
As soon as Peter touched his right hand, the man jumped and stood up.
The lame man was cured at once.
He began to walk and praise the Lord.
He then followed Peter to the Church.
Thus Peter did the first miracle in the name of Jesus.
Oh Lord, we thank you for the life and work of Your Apostle, Peter.
Bless us so that we can work for You.
